info.name: Mantis Bug Tracker REST API
info.description:
Mantis Bug Tracker (MantisHub) REST APIs.

REST API calls have to be authenticated by creating an API token for the user doing the calls, and then passing the API token in the 'Authorization' header.  However, for anonymous access, the API key and header are not needed.  

Postman Environment Variables:
- {{token}} - The API token to be used for authentication.
- {{url}} - The base URL for Mantis instance (e.g. 'https://instance-name.mantishub.io').

There has been significant improvements and feature additions for REST API in each of the recent releases.  Hence, it is highly recommended to use latest release when leveraging the REST APIs.

REST API is enabled by default since MantisBT 2.8.0 release.

item.name: Issues

request.description:
Get issue with the specified id.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.  Issue history included since MantisBT 2.9.0.

response.name: Success
Not Found

variable.description: The issue id to get files for

request.description:
Get all files associated with an issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

response.name: Not Found

request.description:
Get a single file from an issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

query.description: The number of issues to return per page.  Default is 50 but overridable by configuration.

request.description:
Get paginated list of issues.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.  Issue history included since MantisBT 2.9.0.  A fix was implemented in 2.20.0 to avoid filtering out of some issues (e.g. closed issues).

Get all issues for the specified project.

Filtering by project is supported since MantisBT 2.5.0.  Issue history included since MantisBT 2.9.0.

Get all issues matching a user defined filter given the filter id.

Filtering by project or filter is supported since MantisBT 2.5.0.  Issue history included since MantisBT 2.9.0.

This is a standard filter that gets all issues assigned to the logged in user.

Available since MantisBT 2.10.0.

This is a standard filter that gets all issues reported by the logged in user.

Available since MantisBT 2.10.0.

This is a standard filter gets all issues monitored by the logged in user.

Available since MantisBT 2.10.0.

This is a standard filter that gets all issues monitored by the logged in user.

Available since MantisBT 2.10.0.

Shows the creation of issue with minimal information.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

Create an issue with most fields supplied.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

response.name: success

request.description:
Create an issue with attachments

Available since MantisBT 2.12.0.

response.name: success

Add attachments to an existing issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

Create a simple note.

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

item.name: Create an issue note with time tracking

request.description:
Create an issue note with time tracking information.

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.  Time tracking support available in 2.11.0.

item.name: Create an issue note with attachment

request.description:
Create an issue note with an associated attachment.

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.  Attachments supported since MantisBT 2.11.0.

Delete an issue note.

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

Have logged in user monitor the specified issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

Have one or more users monitor the specified issue.  The users can be identified via:

- id - their user id.
- name - their username
- email - their email address
- name_or_realname - a string that corresponds to their username or real name.

If user id is not specified, the logged in user id is added to the issue as the monitoring user.

If user id is not the same as logged in user id, a high access level is required which enables adding other users to the monitor list.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

Attach a tag to issue

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

item.name: Detach a tag from an issue

request.description:
Detach a tag from an issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

item.name: Attach a tag to issue copy

request.description:
Add issue relationship to an issue.  If a relationship with the target issue already exists, it will be updated.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

Delete an issue relationship.

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

Delete an issue relationship.

Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

Delete a filter definition given its id.  This is usable for user defined filters and not for standard filters.

Available since MantisBT 2.10.0.

item.description: A set of REST APIs for handling users.

item.name: Config

request.description:
Get specified config option.  If an option doesn't exist or is marked as private, it will be silently skipped.

Some config options get extra handling to provide more useful response.  For example:

- Enumerations - The enumeration is parsed into an array of objects, each object including id, name and localized label.

For list of possible config options to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/config_defaults_inc.php

When requesting an option, don't supply the `$g_` prefix for the string name.  Only options that are listed as public can be retrieved via this API.  Search the `config_defaults_inc.php` file for `$g_public_config_names` to see the list of public options.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

response.name: Config Get
response.body: {"configs":[{"option":"csv_separator","value":","}]}

request.description:
Get specified config options.  If an option doesn't exist or is marked as private, it will be silently skipped.

Some config options get extra handling to provide more useful response.  For example:

- Enumerations - The enumeration is parsed into an array of objects, each object including id, name and localized label.

For list of possible config options to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/config_defaults_inc.php

When requesting an option, don't supply the `$g_` prefix for the string name.  Only options that are listed as public can be retrieved via this API.  Search the `config_defaults_inc.php` file for `$g_public_config_names` to see the list of public options.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

response.name: Config Get Multiple
response.body: {"configs":[{"option":"csv_separator","value":","},{"option":"status_colors","value":{"new":"#fcbdbd","feedback":"#e3b7eb","acknowledged":"#ffcd85","confirmed":"#fff494","assigned":"#c2dfff","resolved":"#d2f5b0","closed":"#c9ccc4"}},{"option":"status_enum_string","value":[{"id":10,"name":"new","label":"neu"},{"id":20,"name":"feedback","label":"R\u00fcckmeldung"},{"id":30,"name":"acknowledged","label":"anerkannt"},{"id":40,"name":"confirmed","label":"best\u00e4tigt"},{"id":50,"name":"assigned","label":"zugewiesen"},{"id":80,"name":"resolved","label":"erledigt"},{"id":90,"name":"closed","label":"geschlossen"}]}]}

item.description: A set of REST APIs for handling configurations.

item.name: Lang

request.description:
Get the specified localized string.  If string doesn't exist, it will be silently skipped.

For list of possible strings to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/lang/strings_english.txt

When requesting a string, don't supply the `$s_` prefix for the string name.

response.name: success
response.body: {"strings":[{"name":"all_projects","localized":"Alle Projekte"}],"language":"german"}

request.description:
Get the specified localized strings.  If a string doesn't exist, it will be silently skipped.

For list of possible strings to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/lang/strings_english.txt

When requesting a string, don't supply the `$s_` prefix for the string name.

response.name: success
response.body: {"strings":[{"name":"all_projects","localized":"Alle Projekte"},{"name":"status","localized":"Status"},{"name":"move_bugs","localized":"Eintrag verschieben"},{"name":"status_enum_string","localized":"10:neu,20:R\u00fcckmeldung,30:anerkannt,40:best\u00e4tigt,50:zugewiesen,80:erledigt,90:geschlossen"}],"language":"german"}

item.description: A set of APIs for handling localized strings.
